sections.title: Why Tuning is Necessary
sections.content:
Tuning ensures your robot moves accurately and reliably. Poor tuning can cause overshooting, drifting, or inconsistent paths. Good tuning is essential for competitive autonomous routines.

Learn more: Road Runner Docs: Tuning Overview

sections.title: Drive Constants and Their Effects
sections.content:
Drive constants define how your robot's hardware is modeled in code. These include wheel radius, track width, and gear ratio. Adjusting these values changes how Road Runner calculates movement.

See: gm0: Tuning Drive Constants

sections.title: Example: Drive Constants
PID Tuning for Translational and Heading Control
sections.content:
PID controllers help your robot follow paths smoothly. You need to tune both translational (straight-line) and heading (turning) PID values. Adjust each value and observe the robot's response.

Step-by-step guide: Road Runner Docs: PID Tuning

sections.title: Example: PID Coefficients
Testing and Iterative Improvement
sections.content:
Test your tuning with small routines. Make one change at a time and observe the effect. Avoid large, monolithic test filesâ€”write focused tests for each adjustment.

More on testing: gm0: Tuning and Testing

sections.title: Practice: Tune Your Robot
sections.description: Write a test routine to tune your robot's drive constants and PID values. Record your observations after each change.
